member.name: T:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.DateFormatHandling
member.summary: Specifies how dates are formatted when writing JSON text.

member.name: F:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.DateFormatHandling.IsoDateFormat
member.summary: Dates are written in the ISO 8601 format, e.g. "2012-03-21T05:40Z".

member.name: F:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.DateFormatHandling.MicrosoftDateFormat
member.summary: Dates are written in the Microsoft JSON format, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/".

member.name: T:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling
member.summary: Specifies how date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed when reading JSON text.

member.name: F:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling.None
member.summary: Date formatted strings are not parsed to a date type and are read as strings.

member.name: F:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling.DateTime
member.summary: Date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed to .

member.name: F:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling.DateTimeOffset
member.summary: Date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed to .

member.name: T:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling
member.summary: Specifies how to treat the time value when converting between string and .

member.name: F:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Local
member.summary: Treat as local time. If the object represents a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), it is converted to the local time.

member.name: F:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Utc
member.summary: Treat as a UTC. If the object represents a local time, it is converted to a UTC.

member.name: F:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Unspecified
member.summary: Treat as a local time if a is being converted to a string. If a string is being converted to , convert to a local time if a time zone is specified.

member.name: F:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.RoundtripKind
member.summary: Time zone information should be preserved when converting.

member.name: T:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling
member.summary: Specifies default value handling options for the .

member.name: F:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Include
member.summary: Include members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects. Included members are written to JSON. Has no effect when deserializing.

member.name: F:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Ignore
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects so that is is not written to JSON. This option will ignore all default values (e.g. null for objects and nullable types; 0 for integers, decimals and floating point numbers; and false for booleans). The default value ignored can be changed by placing the on the property.

member.name: F:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Populate
member.summary: Members with a default value but no JSON will be set to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: F:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.IgnoreAndPopulate
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects and sets members to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: T:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling
member.summary: Specifies float format handling options when writing special floating point numbers, e.g. , and with .

member.name: F:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling.String
member.summary: Write special floating point values as strings in JSON, e.g. "NaN", "Infinity", "-Infinity".

member.name: F:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling.Symbol
member.summary: Write special floating point values as symbols in JSON, e.g. NaN, Infinity, -Infinity. Note that this will produce non-valid JSON.

member.name: F:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling.DefaultValue
member.summary: Write special floating point values as the property's default value in JSON, e.g. 0.0 for a property, null for a property.

member.name: T:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.FloatParseHandling
member.summary: Specifies how floating point numbers, e.g. 1.0 and 9.9, are parsed when reading JSON text.

member.name: F:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.FloatParseHandling.Double
member.summary: Floating point numbers are parsed to .

member.name: F:Telerik.Newtonsoft.Json.FloatParseHandling.Decimal
member.summary: Floating point numbers are parsed to .

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.FormatterAssemblyStyle
member.summary: Indicates the method that will be used during deserialization for locating and loading assemblies.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.FormatterAssemblyStyle.Simple
member.summary: In simple mode, the assembly used during deserialization need not match exactly the assembly used during serialization. Specifically, the version numbers need not match as the LoadWithPartialName method is used to load the assembly.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.FormatterAssemblyStyle.Full
member.summary: In full mode, the assembly used during deserialization must match exactly the assembly used during serialization. The Load method of the Assembly class is used to load the assembly.
